comments.body: It would be good to see these mobs again, since they of been out in of action for 2 years!

They never pushed back the release, you must have read from an incorrect source, and it is difficult to make a good movie about a game where anything can happen (essentially) so stop trying to rush it, it will come in its own time.
I would LOVE to see mob A added to the oceans, pulling you downward. It would be a quite amazing and unique hostile ocean mob, apart from the only other one that exists: drowned.

Good idea. If you got Minecraft from the App Store on an IOS, you can definitely feel the burden coming from being locked behind testing out beta versions.

You can join the beta program for new features but when leaving you could loose your worlds. I do agree that the snapshots should replace the beta program because it is so much easier. If you want to join the beta program on Pocket Edition with the Google play store, go to Minecraft on the Google Play Store scroll down to join beta but you would have to uninstall and reinstall after clicking leave beta and waiting for your account to be removed from the beta and your worlds will be gone. For windows 10 Edition and IOS I don't know how to join the beta.

As a Pocket Edition user, it is very frustrating not to have snapshots in my game. For people with no space or no money to buy a computer, a tablet or a phone might be their only option to play Minecraft. All other versions get snapshots, so PE should too.
This is a totally good idea!
Just  search it and  add it on your  minecraft  ðŸŒŽ

It would also introduce a grey market where people from more developed nations would shop around for the lowest price before purchasing. Why pay $27 for the (insert first world country) version if I can get the (insert developing nation country) version for $10? Unless you are suggesting that the less expensive version be either feature-limited (in which case nobody would buy it) or geolocked (in which case it would be cracked in days and we're back to square one).

It's not that I don't sympathize. But I honestly don't see how this could work in an open global marketplace.
Minecraft costs the same no matter what country you are in. Plus it wouldn't be very smart to change the price depending on the country, especially when there are VPNs that could change your IP.

oh thank goodness, I was severely worried that this was going to be a racist post. I think that decreasing the price and making it more accessible in developing countries wouldnâ€™t be such a bad idea. a better idea however, would be to eat the rich!!

Two things:

1: If you think geolocking would be cracked in days, you are definitely an optimist.

2: HKD price is more expensive than pounds already

This! This is a very good idea but as other people said, there will be people with better economic backgrounds that will take advantage of this. A solution would be to implement language barriers; if someone pays in Turkish Lira for example, the game should be in Turkish exclusively for that person (this will probably have problems in the long run though). Especially with the coronavirus, my local currency has dropped unimaginably. Minecraft is 23.95 euros, and it's 205TL in conversion, which is a lot.

Someone else commented: "No offense, but I think people of lower developed countries have way different problems to worry about (especially, when they can't afford Minecraft as it is now)." - Please don't be so out of touch, just because Minecraft is expensive to us doesn't mean we can't afford food or shelter.

This is a great idea because due to corona the economy dropped like crazy and it's not affordable in developing countries but I have concerns that the developed country people will probably take advantage of this to get it for cheaper but still good suggestion, but I think it is good to keep the game in english for everybody.

Well, Telltale Games has come back, but they need to re aquire the licenses to continue development. So, there is still a chance.

I would love to be able to easily transfer old worlds into new saves on newer consoles again, like in the past with legacy edition transfers.

It's been 3 years since legacy was unsupported and there still is no official way to do this.
There are 3rd party ways of doing it but most leave chests and other storage blocks empty with others that claim to transfer everything properly for a hefty price.
It's just like Minecraft/Mojang don't care about those who currently can't do this!
I would want this to happen I already have boh versons of MC but to transfer to ps4 or java a 3rd party is required and I am required to pay for the services

'Pocket Edition' has been discontinued, Minecraft on both Android and iOS now run the full version of Bedrock Edition which supports crossplay with all other devices that also run Bedrock; Which includes Xbox One, Playstation 4, Nintendo Switch, Gear VR, Windows 10 and the latest-gen consoles. (Xbox Series X/S)

Java Edition is the only up to date version of the game that does not support crossplay. If your friend is on PC, the way to join players on other platforms is by using the Windows 10 version of the game.
Can I play with my friends?

This is a generalized issue I have too. I like your suggestion!

Assuming Understanding correctly or just adding an extra bit. You should be able to edit the same world using one account account across different devices without using realms, e.g when I edit my world on p.e and then go on my ps4 the world should be edited and look how I just did it on p.e
this would be a great addition, specially when your device dies and you loose your worlds

I agree with this, I build on Xbox mainly because I'm better using my controller, but I still can't use tools on PC I would like to use. I could play the world on the same account through LAN games, but that means I still can't use third-party tools like world painter.

Follow up to this: include a label simply saying "synced" on those worlds and maybe make it so you can share copies of your world with your friends either via sending a code with the seed and name to them online or maybe displaying a QR code when locally. But please Mojang, if you add these ideas don't make it require a subscription to use them.

I apologize, I accidentally made a duplicate of the previous one somehow.

The point is that they VOLUNTARILY decided to separate them for obvious reasons (so this post is pretty useless already). And as far as I'm concerned that's fine, because the Bedrock Edition was developed with another concept that I wouldn't want to see in the Java Edition. So it's good that they stay separate, and I hope this stays apart for as long as possible!
This might be hard to do since Java and Bedrock are written in different code languages. Instead, I would suggest that they make the editions the same instead of merging them.

I think they should spend a lot of their time making bedrock a lot closer and better to java. It would save so much time and money to merge the two game editions together. It may be hard. It may take a lot of time and feedback. But I think it needs to happen in order for updates to keep happening in an orderly fashion. I want the best of both games in one edition. I think this is a great idea.!

I like the idea of this. Like if two kids are friends, but they are on different versions than each other, then they canâ€™t friend each other and it would be bad news cheese. Merge the two versions? Problem solved! And there would be no differences, because there would only be 1 version!

Mojang, this might sound really hard to do, but trust me.

It will be worth it.

I would also love to see a return of the Apple TV app. I am now hooking up my PS4 controller to my iPhone and streaming the video over AirPlay to my Apple TV. It would be much nicer to play directly on the Apple TV itself.
Yes! Apple TV is just a lower-end gaming console. and bedrock on macOS because it makes no sense to support a game on iOS and Windows but not macOS

The Apple TV 4K has a more powerful CPU than the Nintendo Switch; and Minecraft needs that, considering it takes the Switch version embarrassingly long to start up, log in, and load your skin. So if Minecraft returned to Apple TV, I would buy it.

Unfortunately, Microsoft probably wants you to buy an Xbox instead. The removal of the Apple TV Edition from the App Store was rather spiteful - you can still buy the Xbox 360, PS3, Wii U, and New 2DS versions despite the lack of updates.
Yes this would be awesome!

Recently, Apple TV has better performance than Nintendo Switch and Now supports lots console controller. (Apple TV Support Xbox, PS, Nintendo Switch Controllers) I think it's time to come back to Apple TV.

I think it would be awesome to have Minecraft on Apple TV. Especially now that Apple TV hardware has advanced a lot more, I think it would be capable of handling well. Iâ€™d see myself using it a lot!

This post really caught my eye. It gives the best of both worlds. The ban system stays, and not a single person uses it ever. I think you have hit gold with this suggestion my friend. All I got to do is tick the over 18 button. I really am 18, so honestly I see no issue with this. Microsoft wants to protect themselves from lawsuits, and everywhere else has a "tick this box if you are over X legal age". I hope this is the direction microsoft takes the UBS (Universal Bad System).
This sounds like the best compromise Iâ€™ve seen
